title: GitHub Actions
overview: GitHub Actions is my primary CI/CD tool, allowing me to automate testing, building, and deployment workflows directly from my repositories.
usage: I use GitHub Actions to create automated pipelines for continuous integration and deployment, ensuring code quality and streamlining the release process.
insight:
GitHub Actions has transformed my deployment process, particularly for multi-environment setups:

# .github/workflows/deploy.yml name: Deploy Application on: push: branches: [main, staging] pull_request: branches: [main] jobs: test: name: Test runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v3 - name: Set up Python uses: actions/setup-python@v4 with: python-version: '3.10' - name: Install dependencies run: | python -m pip install --upgrade pip pip install -r requirements.txt pip install pytest pytest-cov - name: Run tests run: pytest --cov=app deploy: name: Deploy needs: test runs-on: ubuntu-latest if: github.event_name == 'push' steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v3 - name: Set environment variables run: | if [[ $GITHUB_REF == refs/heads/main ]]; then echo "ENVIRONMENT=production" >> $GITHUB_ENV else echo "ENVIRONMENT=staging" >> $GITHUB_ENV fi - name: Configure AWS credentials uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v1 with: aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }} aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }} aws-region: us-west-2 - name: Deploy to ${{ env.ENVIRONMENT }} run: | ./deploy.sh ${{ env.ENVIRONMENT }}

This workflow automatically runs tests for all pull requests and pushes to main/staging branches, then deploys to the appropriate environment if tests pass. The configuration allows for environment-specific settings and secrets, making the deployment process both secure and flexible.
